request.description:
Updates are not restricted to Approved invoices. So be cautious of the document status before updating.

Use the PUT call to add invoice lines.  Line Num is not sufficient to update an existing line. Include the line ID to update an existing line. If Line ID is not included in the payload, a new line will be created with duplicate line number.

item.name: Submit a draft invoice for approval

request.description:
The mandatory fields must be updated before submitting the invoice-->
An error response as shown below will be returned if the invoice could not be approved. However the submit action will still be successfull.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<errors>
    <error>
        <![CDATA[Status The invoice is 'Pending Receipt' and can not be approved.]]>
  
    </error>
</errors>

item.name: Add approver to an Invoice manually

request.description:
position - string representation of approver position; 
		   acceptable values: before_current_approver, after_current_approver, end_of_list, watcher
approver_id - user_id
approver_type - string, (user, UserGroup)
current_approver_id - active approver_id
Clear the current approval chain and regenerate an new approval chain for an invoice that has had modifications. All manually added approvers will removed

item.name: Bypass all approvals of an Invoice

request.description: kip the current approver and activate the next approver in the chain
Revalidate tolerances. When you update the invoice quantity or price please revalidate tolerances
Dispute an invoice that is in pending approval or pending receipt status. Use the below payload to add dispute reasons INCORRECT-QUANTITY A supplier comment

Void an approved invoice

This can be used on Invoices only on approved and pending receipt Invoices.

BUYER_VOIDABLE_STATUSES = [:pending_receipt, :approved, :draft]
SUPPLIER_VOIDABLE_STATUSES = [:pending_receipt, :approved]

request.description:
*   POST projects/:id/draft
*   POST projects/:id/planned
*   POST projects/:id/in_progress
*   POST projects/:id/complete
*   POST projects/:id/canceled  
      
    Reg Response code:-
    

*   For success state transition :  We display the response as  “204 no content  HTTP status code” (since there was  no content to display for the Project state change) - it is an expected behavior
*   For failure state transition: We display the response as “304 not modified” HTTP status code.

request.description: The process of updating user roles involves two API calls - 1) Remove all roles and 2) Set/add the roles on the user record.

exec: //get the required body parameter values from the environment
//below if condition is used to check and create a brand new access_token only when it exceeds 20hrs since creation or to generate a token for the very first time
//build the POST request for access token request
//make the POST Call and save the access_token as a environment variable
//to show Pass vs Fail during the API calls
pm.test("response should be okay to process", function () {
